data.fullContent: Carol had a favorite sweater that she wore often. It was old, fraying at the edges, and was missing a button on the front. She wanted to wear it to a party, so she decided to use a sewing kit and embroidery thread to patch a hole on the sleeve. Once this was done, she felt like the sweater was new again. She then found a small button with a design on it in the sewing kit and sewed it where the old button was missing. The button matched the colors in the sweater perfectly. After trying on the sweater, she decided to sew on more buttons with beautiful designs. As she finished, she realized how happy she was with the sweater. Now she wanted to wear it every day!

q1.translation: 卡罗尔有一件最喜欢的毛衣，她经常穿。它很旧了，边缘都磨损了，前面还少了一颗扣子。她想穿着它去参加一个聚会，所以她决定用一个缝纫工具和刺绣线来修补袖子上的一个洞。做完这些后，她觉得毛衣又焕然一新了。然后，她在针线包里找到了一个有图案的小纽扣，把它缝在了旧纽扣缺失的地方。纽扣和毛衣的颜色很相配。试穿完毛衣后，她决定多缝上一些有漂亮图案的扣子。

She then found a small button with a design on it in the sewing kit and sewed it where the old button was missing. The button matched the colors in the sweater perfectly. After trying on the sweater, she decided to sew on more buttons with beautiful designs.

options.sentence: When she took the first one off to try on the next, she was astounded--that was the very first cloth dress she had ever owned.
Carol had always been fascinated by sweaters.
This outfit was so comfortable, she bought another one, then another and another.
As she finished, she realized how happy she was with the sweater.

options.sentence: Carol didn't have much experience making clothes, but with a few months of work, she was able to create her own unique patterns.
Carol knew that she could easily afford to buy more, but she wanted her sweaters to be as beautiful as possible.
After each day, Carol had to take out the small bits of thread that remained and put them in a plastic container.
Carol used a sewing kit and embroidery thread to patch a hole on the sleeve.
